instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3510</CHIP>::5 is getting 3.4
::10 = 3v
::9 = 0v.

Not sure what I should be seeing. At what point does it get turned on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
threads.message: Measure in diode mode pins 9, 10, 6 and 7....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
threads.message:
9 = 734
10 = 677
6 = ol
7 = 361

Would Pin6 be the chip or the trace?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
threads.message:
How can I run a jumper?

There are no points along the way, it goes from there straight to <CHIP>U0500</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
threads.message: Scrape off pad 6 and 7 under <CHIP>U3510</CHIP> then run wires from pin 6 and 7 to <SIGNAL>TP_USB_5P</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>TP_USB_5N</SIGNAL> respectively.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
threads.message:
If I run a jumper wire from pin 6 to <SIGNAL>TP_USB_5P</SIGNAL> I get no picture.

Remove the jumper and the picture comes back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
threads.message: You need to disconnect the BT from both original USB data lines and run 2 wires to the unused <SIGNAL>USB_5</SIGNAL> lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
threads.message:
Gotchya.
Thought I was jumpering.

If the existing lines are affecting it, are they really broken?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Bluetooth not available.
threads.message: I don't know, just cut the old USB lines and wire them to the spare one.
